commentPreTextItems.html: 9.32am Start delayed by two minutes. Three slips and a gully. "Play," says the umpire

9.25am How ya doin'? That early-morning anticipation, which only Test cricket brings, is back. It starts with Chennai, which is hosting its first Test in three years. This is where, with the annihilation of Australia in 2013, India began a dominant run of supremacy at home. They are yet to a lose a home series since then. In fact you can count the number of Tests they have lost on your fingers. One of the big reasons for this dominance is their spin twins. One of them turned 38 day before yesterday. Will it be R Ashwin's last at his home ground? India's new coach starts his innings here. And what about the Bangladesh pace attack? They are so good that Bangladesh have retained their pace attack for the first time since New Zealand 2022. Their two spinners are no slouch. So much to look forward to.
9:22am: Play starts in under ten minutes. Sidharth Monga will be in to call the action.

Renugopal : "Really surprised to see both captains wanting to field first and choosing 3 fast bowlers despite moisture/little bit grass on the pitch. After all this chennai and we are in middle of a heatwave and whatever mositure/little grass will dry out in session and half." I'm with you but the teams seem to be backing their strengths. Bangladesh are going with an attack that won them a series in Pakistan, India are looking to roll the visitors with a high-quality pace attack like they did in 2019.

Arif: "Why not bat first!" Moisture in the pitch, in theory, gives the seamers an advantage and that's what the teams want to capitalise on. It is a conditions-based call but still a rare one. Sampath, from our stats team, informs that only eight previous instances of a visiting team putting India into bat in a Test match in India. Six of those ended in a draw, while Australia won the other two - both by 10 wickets.
SMS: "So happy to see Akash Deep getting rewarded for his consistent performances in the domestic circuit!! He bowled superbly in his debut series against England as well!!"

S Kishore : "I am here in Chennai, and I can tell you that for the past week , it's been overcast conditions will suit for bowling especially in the morning first hour. As the day progresses , it will become hot and humid which will ease out the pitch for batting. "
Bangladesh's line-up comes up on the broadcast ten minutes after the toss:

Bangladesh XI: 1 Shadman Islam, 2 Zakir Hasan, Najmul Hossain Shanto (capt), 4 Mominul Haque, 5 Mushfiqur Rahim, 6 Shakib Al Hasan, 7 Litton Das (wk), 8 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 9 Hasan Mahmud, 10 Nahid Rana, 11 Taskin Ahmed
India XI: 1 Rohit Sharma (capt), 2 Yashasvi Jaiswal, 3 Shubman Gill, 4 Virat Kohli, 5 KL Rahul, 6 Rishabh Pant (wk), 7 Ravindra Jadeja, 8 R Ashwin, 9 Jasprit Bumrah, 10 Akash Deep, 11 Mohammed Siraj
Last time a team opted to bowl at Chepauk was in 1982, Mathew from our social-media team informs; so first time in 21 Tests that a team winning the toss has opted to bowl

Rohit Sharma, India captain says he would have fielded first. The conditions will be challenging. We have prepared well. Looking at the 10 Tests coming up, they will be important. Trying to maintain focus here. Came here a week back, good prep leading up. We've done everything we're supposed to do. We've gone with three seamers - Akash, Bumrah Siraj, two spinners - Ashwin and Jadeja

Najmul Hossain Shanto, Bangladesh captain, says there is moisture on the wicket and will like to use the conditions. It looks hard and will be good for the seamers in the first session. Says the Pakistan series has given them confidence. All the experienced and young guys give us a good mix. Like in the last game in Pakistan, we will go with three seamers and two allrounders.
9am: Ravi Shastri is suited up for the toss. It's red-ball cricket time, he says. Rohit Sharma gets a cheer from the crowd. Bangladesh win the toss and will bowl

Zaman: "@Ekanth, 3 spinner 2 pacer or 3 pacer 2 spinner? what is your opinion ?" I still think three spinners for both sides even though the comms on TV think India will go with three seamers.. Toss coming up in a minute.

Pitch: Dinesh Karthik says it's a day unlike the regular Chennai day - cooler at 28 degrees but will go to 34. It's a red-soil pitch, so there will be bounce and turn. There is some moisture underneath, so the pacers will have assistance at the start. He says Bangladesh will bowl first if they win the toss, but India will bat to take the positive option at the start and unleash their spinners in the fourth innings.
Chandika Hathurusinghe: This is the most well-rounded Bangladesh team in my time

8:50am: Bangladesh have never won a Test in India but their current side is well set up to challenge the hosts if not topple them. Mehidy Hasan and Shakib Al Hasan are elite allrounders adding balance. With Taskin Ahmed, Hasan Mahmud, and Nahid Rana, they have the pacers as well. They have a similar selection question to India's regarding bowling combination - whether to include Taijul Islam in a three-spinner attack or go with the pacers mentioned above? The batting is what will be challenged more severely, especially the top order. Zakir Hasan showed in the second Test against Pakistan that he can counterattack. Shadman Islam will partner him, Mominul Haque is the defensive, and the captain Shanto will give the attacking option.

video.title: Manjrekar: Choice between Rahul and Sarfaraz isn't straightforward
video.seoTitle: India vs Bang Test series Manjrekar choice between Rahul and Sarfaraz isn't easy
video.summary: Sanjay Manjrekar says India should give this decision careful consideration

commentPreTextItems.html: There is also the curious case of KL Rahul and where he fits in India's line-up. It's been a long road, and he returns older and wiser in Chennai, where has has special memories. Can he etch one more this game?

Vinod: "Kohli is lagging behind fab 4 in tests and his average also dropped below 50. He missed Eng test series when he seemed to be in superb form against SA. I hope he scores atleast 5 hundreds in 10 matches this season and go up the ladder again." Yep, his comeback is a big talking point, as is Rishabh Pant's. The keeper-batter returns to Tests after close to two years. He played a game in the Duleep Trophy as well. Let's see how they go
Rohit Sharma: 'You want your best players to play all games, but that's not possible'

8:40am: Aayush has hit the nail on the head, hasn't he? India want to build as strong a pace attack as possible for Australia and know they have the luxury of Jasprit Bumrah. But they need to ensure Mohammed Shami isn't rushed in and give game-time to up-and-coming bowlers like Akash Deep and Yash Dayal. And do they go with two spinners or three on a red-soil Chepauk surface? We'll find out soon.

Aayush: "Expecting a much more competitive series this time between these sides. India has to prepare balance tracks - partly because BAN spinners are quality and Indian batters against spin aren't what they used to be. But also, India need to have a look at enough pace options for the tour down under."

video.title: Are turning pitches a good idea for India against Bangladesh?
video.seoTitle: India vs Bangladesh Test series are turning pitches a good idea for India
video.summary: Sanjay Manjrekar on why rank turners may not be the way to go for India against Bangladesh

commentPreTextItems.html: Match Preview by Ashish Pant: High-flying Bangladesh seek to dent India's mighty home record

Arjun: "Got a minor heart attack when I read the words 'When it rains...'!! Thankfully this wasn't about the actual rain!" Raju, from our scoring team, says not to worry about rain and it has been hot of late.

8:30am, Day 1, session 1: When it rains, it pours, and Test cricket is going to pour over India in the next 3-4 months. Ten of them, five at home and just as many away. A chance to make their third straight WTC final at the end of it. At the other end are Bangladesh, coming off their greatest ever Test series win in Pakistan. Captain Najmul Hossain Shanto isn't looking too far ahead, and alongside Chandika Hathurasinghe as coach, he will like to push India, if not go one better.

commentTextItems.html: good length, angling away, thick edge, soft hands, gully dives to prevent runs

commentPreTextItems.html: Gully is more of a fifth slip

commentTextItems.html: short of a length, angling away, shapes up to cut, but leaves it alone. Good carry
beaten. Short of a length, pitches around leg, seams away, Jaiswal fends at it. Good carry too. Das collects it in front of his shoulder
tucked away off the hip for a single

commentPreTextItems.html: Three slips and a fifth slip for Rohit Sharma too

commentTextItems.html: short of a length, not close enough to make Rohit play
loose waft. Short of a length, wide, and Rohit has a go at it. Extra bounce, holds its line too. Rohit lucky to not edge this

commentTextItems.html: solid front-foot defence to a length ball
slightly closer to off, Ashwin gets a stride in, and then leaves it alone
wide length ball, easy love. Das collects in front of first slip
uff lovely punchy drive. On the up, straight bat, just a check-drive, and it goes straight of mid-off
runs off the thick outside edge for a single to deep point
throws his hands at a wide length ball, gets a thick edge over the slips but the third is too square to catch this

commentTextItems.html: Akash tries another big hit, but this time he seems to have misjudged the length. He thinks it is full enough to drive but it isn't, and gets big on him to end up as a skier for mid-off

commentPreTextItems.html: Jasprit Bumrah walks out ahead of Mohammed Siraj

commentTextItems.html: no third, and Bumrah opens the face on a wide length ball to guide this just there for four runs

commentTextItems.html: good length, top of off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, straighter, defended back to him
tucked away off the hip for a single to square leg
short of a length, 136ks, defended solidly by Bumrah
beauty but just a touch short. On a good length, but still slightly short of taking the edge. beats his outside edge, though, and sails over the stumps
a single off the last ball of the over. So no shielding business here. Tucked into the leg side as Rana strays

commentTextItems.html: wide length ball, no feet from Bumrah as he pushes at it, and is beaten
fuller, straighter, defended uppishly b ack to Taskin, who dives to try to catch it. Never going to get to it

lovely yorker, hits the toe I think, draws an lbw appeal, but the suggestion is it is missing leg. No, Bumrah has got some bat on it. Ashwin is quick to call him through for a run even as Bangladesh appeal
bouncer, Ashwin looks to ramp it over the slips, but fails to make contact

dismissalText.long: c Najmul Hossain Shanto b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Ravichandran Ashwin c Najmul Hossain Shanto b Taskin Ahmed 113 (133b 11x4 2x6 223m) SR: 84.96

commentTextItems.html: Ashwin miscues one. Not the best of shots. Throws his hands at a wide length ball, doesn't quite reach it, toe-ends it up in the air, and the mid-off runs back and to his right to complete the catch. Ashwin gets a standing ovation.

commentPostTextItems.html: Time for a drink. S Sudarshanan will be with you after the break

commentPreTextItems.html: Hello everyone! Bangladesh have managed to pick up three wickets - like they had done yesterday - and India look like they could fall short of 400. Bumrah now has Mohammed Siraj for company

commentTextItems.html: Length ball on the fourth stump, 139.9kph, Siraj lets that be. Good carry to the keeper

commentPreTextItems.html: Mahmud back on

commentTextItems.html: Drama! Huge appeal for lbw, not given, Bangladesh opt for the review. Mahmud spears it full on leg, Bumrah looks to clip it away but seems to have been hit on the leg. He comes down the track in search of a run even as Bangladesh appealfor the lbw. Meanwhile, there is a shy at the batter's end but it misses the stumps and Bumrah gets a couple

dismissalText.long: c Zakir Hasan b Hasan Mahmud
dismissalText.commentary: Jasprit Bumrah c Zakir Hasan b Hasan Mahmud 7 (9b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 77.77

commentTextItems.html: Five-for for Mahmud in back-to-back innings! Lands it on a length just outside off, squaring up Bumrah and taking the outside edge that flies to third slip. Mahmud looks skywards, goes down on his knees and does the sajdah as he becomes the first Bangladesh bowler to pick up a five-for In India. India bowled out for 376

commentPostTextItems.html: 10:36am Bangladesh have picked up the four remaining Indian wickets in just over an hour. So perhaps first part of their plan done. Taskin was much better in his lines and lengths today, making the batters play against the second new ball. He dealt the big blow early on to deny Jadeja the century, and that opened the floodgates. Akash hit a few sumptous shots, and so did Ashwin, but they fell soon. Job done with the bat for Ashwin, and he will be licking his lips to have a go at Bangladesh with the ball. A short turnaround between the innings, don't go too far. Back shortly for Bangladesh's reply
Sampath pings to say that this is just the fourth instance of all ten Indian batters getting out caught in a Test innings at home
